edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class NodeProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.NodeProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class NodeProperties
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class NodeProperties encapsulates the capabilities a computational node must have in order to run a certain PJ2 Task as part of a PJ2 Job. The following capabilities may be specified:
    • nodeName — The name of the node needed.
    • cores — The number of CPU cores needed.
    • gpus — The number of GPU accelerators needed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL_CORES
      Indicates that the task requires all the cores on the node.
      static int ALL_GPUS
      Indicates that the task requires all the GPU accelerators on the node.
      static String ANY_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
      static int DEFAULT_CORES
      Indicates that the cores property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_GPUS
      Indicates that the gpus property is defaulted.
      static String DEFAULT_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the nodeName property is defaulted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties()
        Construct a new node properties object. All settings are defaulted.

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties(String nodeName,
              int cores,
              int gpus)
        Construct a new node properties object with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name on which the task must execute, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        cores - Number of CPU cores the task requires, ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        gpus - Number of GPU accelerators the task requires, ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if cores or gpus is illegal.

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties(NodeProperties node)
        Construct a new node properties object that is a copy of the given node properties object.
        Parameters:
        node - Node properties object to copy.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if node is null.

      • NodeProperties

        public NodeProperties(String capabilities)
        Construct a new node properties object with capabilities specified by the given string. The capabilities string must be in the format "name,cores,gpus", where name is the name of the node, cores is the number of CPU cores in the node (≥ 1), and gpus is the number of GPU accelerators in the node (≥ 0).
        Parameters:
        capabilities - Capabilities string.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if capabilities is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if capabilities is illegal.

    • Method Detail

      • nodeName

        public NodeProperties nodeName(String nodeName)
        Set the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        See Also:
        nodeName()

      • nodeName

        public String nodeName()
        Get the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run. If the nodeName property is defaulted, ANY_NODE_NAME is returned, indicating that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
        Returns:
        Node name, or ANY_NODE_NAME.
        See Also:
        nodeName(String)

      • cores

        public NodeProperties cores(int cores)
        Set the cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires.
        Parameters:
        cores - Number of cores (≥ 1), ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if cores is illegal.
        See Also:
        cores()

      • cores

        public int cores()
        Get the cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires. If the cores property is defaulted, ALL_CORES is returned, indicating that the task requires all the cores on the node.
        Returns:
        Number of cores (≥ 1), or ALL_CORES.
        See Also:
        cores(int)

      • gpus

        public NodeProperties gpus(int gpus)
        Set the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires.
        Parameters:
        gpus - Number of GPUs (≥ 0), ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Returns:
        This node properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gpus is illegal.
        See Also:
        gpus()

      • gpus

        public int gpus()
        Get the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires. If the gpus property is defaulted, 0 is returned, indicating that the task requires no GPU accelerators.
        Returns:
        Number of GPUs (≥ 0).
        See Also:
        gpus(int)
